forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As evening descends upon Downtown San Francisco, there is a soft murmuring of clouds enshrouding the city, hinting at a hint of nostalgia for the humidity of early spring. The air carries a coolness, flirting with the low fifties, while the gentle southwest breeze whispers through the streets at a leisurely pace. A chance of rain lingers, hinting at an atmospheric play that may occur before dawn. The night sky may seem a bit more alive with dim stars occasionally peeking through the veils of clouds.

Tomorrow promises to unveil a more cheerful visage, transforming the overcast remnants into sunlit warmth as temperatures usher themselves toward fifty-nine degrees. The clarity of mid-morning skies will gradually reclaim the depth and color of the city, inviting the West winds to dance joyously through the neighborhoods. Dress comfortably, perhaps layering a light sweater over a simple T-shirt, allowing for an easy transition from the brisk morning into the balmy afternoon. 

A leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero would be delightful, perhaps stopping by a favorite café for a warm drink and enjoying the gentle hum of activity around you. Alternatively, wander through the nooks and crannies of the Mission District, discovering art-filled alleys and indulging in the culinary delights that await. The evening holds its mysteries, with a gentle reminder that even the mundane can become extraordinary when viewed through the lens of a San Francisco spring night.
